info.description: The Azure management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Azure Key Vault.
info.title: KeyVaultManagementClient

200.description: OK -- Operation to check the vault name availability was successful.

post.description: Checks that the vault name is valid and is not already in use.

200.description: Retrieved information about all deleted key vaults in a subscription.

get.description: Gets information about the deleted vaults in a subscription.

parameters.description: The name of the vault.
parameters.name: vaultName

parameters.description: The location of the deleted vault.
parameters.name: location

200.description: Retrieved information about the deleted vault.

get.description: Gets the deleted Azure key vault.

parameters.description: The name of the soft-deleted vault.
parameters.name: vaultName

parameters.description: The location of the soft-deleted vault.
parameters.name: location

post.description: Permanently deletes the specified vault. aka Purges the deleted Azure key vault.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: $top

200.description: Get information about all key vaults in the specified subscription.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: $top

200.description: The private endpoint connection was successfully deleted.

202.description: The private endpoint connection is being deleted.

Location.description: The URI to poll for completion status.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in the location header.

204.description: The private endpoint connection does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified private endpoint connection associated with the key vault.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the specified private endpoint connection associated with the key vault.

200.description: The state of private endpoint connection was updated successfully.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: (specified only if operation does not finish synchronously) The URI to poll for completion status. The response of this URI may be synchronous or asynchronous.

Retry-After.description: (specified only if operation does not finish synchronously) The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Updates the specified private endpoint connection associated with the key vault.

requestBody.description: The intended state of private endpoint connection.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the private link resources supported for the key vault.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.
parameters.name: $filter

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: $top

parameters.description: Azure Resource Manager Api Version.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Get information about all key vaults in the subscription.

get.description: The List operation gets information about the vaults associated with the subscription.

PrivateEndpointConnectionName.description: Name of the private endpoint connection associated with the key vault.
PrivateEndpointConnectionName.name: privateEndpointConnectionName

ResourceGroupName.description: Name of the resource group that contains the key vault.
ResourceGroupName.name: resourceGroupName

SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId

VaultName.description: The name of the key vault.
VaultName.name: vaultName

AccessPolicyEntry.description: An identity that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID.

applicationId.description: Application ID of the client making request on behalf of a principal

objectId.description: The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must be unique for the list of access policies.

permissions.description: Permissions the identity has for keys, secrets and certificates.

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

message.description: An error message explaining the Reason value in more detail.

nameAvailable.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the name is available for you to use. If true, the name is available. If false, the name has already been taken or is invalid and cannot be used.

reason.description: The reason that a vault name could not be used. The Reason element is only returned if NameAvailable is false.

CloudError.description: An error response from Key Vault resource provider

CloudErrorBody.description: An error response from Key Vault resource provider

code.description: Error code. This is a mnemonic that can be consumed programmatically.

message.description: User friendly error message. The message is typically localized and may vary with service version.

DeletedVault.description: Deleted vault information with extended details.

id.description: The resource ID for the deleted key vault.

name.description: The name of the key vault.

type.description: The resource type of the key vault.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of deleted vaults.

location.description: The location of the original vault.

vaultId.description: The resource id of the original vault.

IPRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility of a vault from a specific ip address or ip range.

value.description: An IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78).

NetworkRuleSet.description: A set of rules governing the network accessibility of a vault.

bypass.description: Tells what traffic can bypass network rules. This can be 'AzureServices' or 'None'.  If not specified the default is 'AzureServices'.

defaultAction.description: The default action when no rule from ipRules and from virtualNetworkRules match. This is only used after the bypass property has been evaluated.

ipRules.description: The list of IP address rules.

virtualNetworkRules.description: The list of virtual network rules.

Permissions.description: Permissions the identity has for keys, secrets, certificates and storage.

id.description: Full identifier of the private endpoint resource.

PrivateEndpointConnectionProperties.description: Properties of the private endpoint connection resource.

privateEndpoint.description: Properties of the private endpoint object.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: Approval state of the private link connection.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the private endpoint connection.

PrivateLinkResourceListResult.description: A list of private link resources

PrivateLinkResourceProperties.description: Properties of a private link resource.

groupId.description: Group identifier of private link resource.

requiredMembers.description: Required member names of private link resource.

requiredZoneNames.description: Required DNS zone names of the the private link resource.

PrivateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: An object that represents the approval state of the private link connection.

actionRequired.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

description.description: The reason for approval or rejection.

status.description: Indicates whether the connection has been approved, rejected or removed by the key vault owner.

tags.description: Tags assigned to the key vault resource.

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the key vault resource.

location.description: Azure location of the key vault resource.

name.description: Name of the key vault resource.

type.description: Resource type of the key vault resource.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of vault resources.

name.description: SKU name to specify whether the key vault is a standard vault or a premium vault.

tags.description: Tags assigned to the key vault resource.

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the key vault resource.

location.description: Azure location of the key vault resource.

name.description: Name of the key vault resource.

type.description: Resource type of the key vault resource.

VaultAccessPolicyParameters.description: Parameters for updating the access policy in a vault

id.description: The resource id of the access policy.

location.description: The resource type of the access policy.

name.description: The resource name of the access policy.

type.description: The resource name of the access policy.

VaultAccessPolicyProperties.description: Properties of the vault access policy

accessPolicies.description: An array of 0 to 16 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID.

VaultCheckNameAvailabilityParameters.description: The parameters used to check the availability of the vault name.

VaultCreateOrUpdateParameters.description: Parameters for creating or updating a vault

tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to the key vault.

location.description: The supported Azure location where the key vault should be created.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of vaults.

VaultPatchParameters.description: Parameters for creating or updating a vault

tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to the key vault.

accessPolicies.description: An array of 0 to 1024 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID.

createMode.description: The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not.

enablePurgeProtection.description: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this vault. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this vault and its content - only the Key Vault service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. The setting is effective only if soft delete is also enabled. Enabling this functionality is irreversible - that is, the property does not accept false as its value.

enableSoftDelete.description: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this key vault. It does not accept false value.

enabledForDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.

enabledForDiskEncryption.description: Property to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.

enabledForTemplateDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.

networkAcls.description: A collection of rules governing the accessibility of the vault from specific network locations.

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

accessPolicies.description: An array of 0 to 1024 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID. When `createMode` is set to `recover`, access policies are not required. Otherwise, access policies are required.

createMode.description: The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not.

enablePurgeProtection.description: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this vault. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this vault and its content - only the Key Vault service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. The setting is effective only if soft delete is also enabled. Enabling this functionality is irreversible - that is, the property does not accept false as its value.

enableSoftDelete.description: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this key vault. It does not accept false value.

enabledForDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.

enabledForDiskEncryption.description: Property to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.

enabledForTemplateDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.

networkAcls.description: Rules governing the accessibility of the key vault from specific network locations.

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connections associated with the key vault.

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

vaultUri.description: The URI of the vault for performing operations on keys and secrets.

VirtualNetworkRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility of a vault from a specific virtual network.

id.description: Full resource id of a vnet subnet, such as '/subscriptions/subid/resourceGroups/rg1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/test-vnet/subnets/subnet1'.
